message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.MA, cs.GT. 

The paper deals with a communication system where an energy harvesting node intermittently sends updates to a receiver through sensing and transmission operations. This involves information theory (cs.IT) as the paper considers the age of information (AoI) at the receiver. The paper also deals with networked systems (cs.NI) as it considers the transmission queue and the data buffer. The paper proposes a threshold-based stopping rule to minimize the average peak AoI, which involves control systems (cs.SY) and optimization (cs.MA). Finally, the paper considers the performance of different hybrid waiting and thresholding schemes, which involves game theory (cs.GT).
